pr_title: limit information in CLI error printing

timeline.message: limit information in CLI error printing

timeline.bodyText:
Does the command still shows available options when invoked without any argument?
If no, would you revert this? I rely on the help output to recall the arguments.
timeline.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText: It does not. We should distinguish help from an error condition. The most common convention seems to be that -h or --help prints help.
replies.author: elharo

replies.bodyText: Common behaviors print the help when a required argument is missing. Would you update this PR to do so?
replies.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText:
I added a --help/-h option. With that there are no required arguments any more.
Also, I think there's an existing bug where jar files can't be selected.
replies.author: elharo

replies.bodyText: I just ran LinkageCheckerMain in this branch without any argument and it existed 0 without showing anything. The empty output does not tell what option I have to add LinkgeCheckerMain.  Would you fix that?
replies.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText:
Common behaviors print the help when a required argument is missing.

I'm referring java or javac command without any argument, for example.
replies.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText:
I'll see your javac and raise you a gcc:
$ gcc
gcc: fatal error: no input files
compilation terminated.

but sure, whatever.
replies.author: elharo

timeline.message: print help when no arguments are present
